title.narrative: 4.3 IMPROVED KNOWLEDGE AND CAPACITY TO PROVIDE CHILD FRIENDLY AND GENDER SENSITIV

description.narrative: 4.3. Justice/security professionals and social workers have improved knowledge and capacity to provide child friendly and gender- sensitive services to protect children in contact with the justice system, which contributes to Access To Justice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children and adolescents have improved protection from all forms of violence, abuse and exploitation.

participating-org.narrative: KENDRIYIA BAL NYAYA SAMITIKO SACHIW SECRETARIAT OF CENTRAL CHILD JUSTIC COMMITTEE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 4.3. Justice/security professionals and social workers have improved knowledge and capacity to provide child friendly and gender-sensitive services to protect children in contact with the justice system

description.narrative: Despite;increased needs, the police and justice sectors were challenged by limited mobility, physical limitations to access services. UNICEF supported coordination with child protection actors, to ensure continued responsiveness. UNICEF expanded its support to police and justice sectors to strategically use data and community networks to enhance understanding of risks and adapt working modalities. For the first time since the adoption of the Act relating to children in 2018, 100% of the districts in the country have an appointed probation officers serving the needs of children in conflict with the law, paving the way for increased use of non-custodial measures. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:04/01/2022
